comments.text: From where it says on hitchwiki, there‚Äôs a path around the gate so you don‚Äôt even have to climb. Then keep going and on your left there‚Äôs a natural small hill that leads to the motorway and the fence has been rolled back and so you can go straight in. After getting down I walked to after the tolls but I was wearing a hi-vis jacket (9:20pm ish on Saturday in March) and once I stood just after where the trucks come out, I held my sign for no more than 15 seconds before a lovely guy took me to the
Best spot to head to Bordeaux. Requires a huge sign. Instruction on hitchwiki to find the way to the toll

There were two of us with a lot of luggage. We wanted to go to Orleans and waited about 20 minutes before someone offered to take us to Montauban, where we found a car in 3 minutes to Orleans. We stood in the middle of the toll booth, standing on a concrete block and holding up our sign.
Really good spot, I went to Bordeaux, not much space but you get a ton of cars stopping juste besides you if your inside the p√©age.
The red door is closed but it is really easy to climb over the fance. Met another hitchhiker there and we got away right away.
Very big and very good. Lot of  people going in to nederlands and belgium
found a ride to Millau, south of France, really easily, there are so many people going south, to Bordeaux or Clermont Ferrand.
With no effort - a driver just saw our sign and asked where we were heading, all while we were eating inside the gas station - we got a ride to Tours.
It worked very fine heading to Tours. Almost no waiting time.

Busy place. Easy to change sides thanks to the restaurant bridge. Also easy to reach from the Saran-Gidy street (one fence to climb).
11AM heading south: Possibilities for far rides up to Spain; sadly no-one going to the city or Orl√©ans.
10AM heading north: 80% going to Paris, finally found someone going east towards Switzerland.
Many cars stopped, but to Clermont-Ferrand, I waited around 45 minutes.

a really good spot to go to any destination.

I stayed in the exit of the gas station where there is a way coming from the circle point near, and I wasn't using any panel, lot of cars stopped but they were all going north, then I used a panel "SUD" which means South in French and I got a ride after some minutes directly to Toulouse! (we were two persons boy and girl)
got a lift in 1 minute to Gap

This place is very nice, Free Wi-fi even outside
Grenoble - Lyon very fast ...

If you can get a lift to here, it's a good point to leave Grenoble towards Valence or Lyon (or as a last stop before getting into Grenoble). It's a toll, just position yourself next to the barriers with a big sign - make sure it's ok with the inspectors.

Very good spot, best one if u want to go east from paris

Good spot, got a direct ride to Strasbourg after 30min. Many german cars so quite easy to go far.
The only thing is that it's quite long to get there, but you can hitchhike in the industrial area and hopefully save 20min walking :)
As soon as we got here we asked a car with a german license plate for a ride and got all the way to Manheim
Good spot, but eventually paid some little money to Romanian guys for trip to Nurnberg (16 EUR per person) rather that staying overnight.

Very good spot, got a ride to Germany after 3 minutes. 
The only problem that it takes some time to get there from Paris. Used Metro and  public trains and a hitch to get here from Bussy Saint Georges.

Lot of passing cars, lots of belges and germans. I just wanted to go to Lilles and found easily a car. I didn't want to go there at first but we got a bit of a miscomprehension at Vemars so I stopped there and I'm thinking of using this spot again if I ever want to speedrun to germany and further north lol.

i always hike from orry la ville RER to la chapelle en serval then there i ask the driver to drop me at the toll (because from senlis it's a climbing way and not so easy for pedestrian)
Before I even got here, I was walking with sign AMSTERDAM on my back and I got a direct lift from first NL car, just before trying to get on the highway xD

It is the way to get round paris, but don't try that in the weekends and especially on sundays, because there will be no lorries and since the paris agglomeration is so big, few cars go round except in holliday periods.
With sign "8KM" just to get to the next oframp.
great station for nantes - i got a car at like 2 am after a little bit of asking
superbe aire d‚Äôautoroute pour aller direction rennes ! se mettre au croisement avant la sortie, les voitures roulent lentement c‚Äôest top

tr√®s bon spot pour aller vers lyon/nord de la france. se mettre avant la sortie vers la droite. avoir un panneau indicatif de la direction

got a ride to montpeiller in 30 with a sign for n√Æmes.

Best place from Poitiers to Limoges, it really is an easy ride to go little by little to Limoges, after this place the road is straight, with roundabouts and always a lot a space to park
Good spot to bel-air
Very nice place to Limoges, with or without sign (avec ou sans panneau)
Spot id√©al, j'ai attendu 2 minutes avec un panneau Lyon.

Really good spot. Some people were going to Montpellier / N√Æmes but we were going to Aix en Provence, so we had to say no. Then a guy going to Marseille took us to Aire de Lan√ßon en P.

Good spot , we found a car to the direction of Nimes
Perfect gas station. This spot on roundabout was in my case good and I took ride to B√©ziers.
we were asking people around the car in the parking and we found someone going to Narbonne really quickly

Lot of traffic south-east. Took me some time to get a ride towards Montpellier. Very comfortable to stand next to the roundabout with a sign, drivers passing by slowly can see you and have time to think. :)
Beaucoup de passage, les gens ont de la place pour s'arr√™ter mais ils roulent plut√¥t vite. Trajet direct jusqu'√† Rennes !
It's true, really good place!
J'approuve, tr√®s bon spot, m√™me si les voitures peuvent arriver un peu trop vite ou par paquet, l'effet de groupe les fait continuer...
Le meilleur!
tr√®s bon endroit. jamais attendu plus de 30 minutes ici en direction de ploermel et rennes
Very good spot. Got picked to Lille within 10 minutes. Perfect to stand in between the lanes.
Good spot, people working at the toll are very nice and helpful, better be at the entrance of the toll than at the toll's parking

Wanted to go to Paris. We did not even wait. A car directly picked us while we were starting to write Paris on our board.
PERFECT SPOT

Btw : we passed through the industrial zone to get to the spot. There is a hole next to a metal door, si you don‚Äôt need to climb up
I went until strasbourg ! You can also ask the people at the toilets and get there when it rains. When it rains you have better chance to be taken (it worked for me and a friend (girl) of mine)
Frankly, never waited more than 10 minutes on this toll, searching for a car going to Paris. Don't hesitate to refuse cars not going until the paris toll station ! Lots of traffic going there !

Going to Lyon, we got a ride to Valence. We tried on a sunday afternoon, under a small rain, and there was not a lot of cars going this way, but we got someone after 30min (firstly under the tree, then better located on the street).
Great spot to go to Aire de Lan√ßon de Provence. I then found quickly a car that took me to Montpellier.
Not even put my bag down and got a lift early on a monday morning

Direction : N√Æmes/ Montpellier or Avignon. 
I walked 45min/1h from the city centre to go there. The spot is just before the entrance to the highway with space for cars to stop.I used a sign "PEAGE" which means "toll" in French. I wanted to go to the next p√©age "P√©age de Lan√ßon". 
It was a lucky day because I got a car in 10 min going to Montpellier :D
so yes i alked there because the freakin bus in france never comes somehow but i got away pretty fast and good and with frank zappa music to avignon

-----2024----
It's the first petrol station after Rennes and it's hard to get to, but it's worth it! 

Taken in a few minutes towards Le Mans by a young couple, the toll booth a few km further on looks to be a good spot too ;)
Excellent place during the day, trajet direct jusqu'√† Paris ;)
Best place to Paris ;)

Best place is surely the toll station, anyway, you can ask drivers to go there. If he is not going on the motorway, you wan walk from the national exit to the toll. One kilometer and about 10 minutes to walk !!!!
Best Place to Paris
Great spot!
Very good spot! A lot of traffic and place to stop on the parking! Caught a direct ride to Paris!

For going North, this services is excellent.

Ce lieu ne fonctionne plus
 depuis les nouveau travaux de connexion entre l'A6 et l'A89

Easy for cars to stop, a lot of traffic, and cars going slowly. Use a cartoon "Cannes - A8" to get the big gas station just before Cannes exit. Try to walk on the other side of the safety barrier, not so easy at th

If it is sunny and not too late, give it a try, preferably with a sign.

I got a lift after 10-15 min, the guy dropped me at a suburb train station (RER), from there i paid 3.50 ‚Ç¨ to arrive to Paris.

-----2024----

An ideal place to get to NANTES/SUD

I waited 5 min there

To Nantes and southern. Best place I know

10-15 mins each time, used this spot twice, amazing for monaco
Good spot, it worked with a sign of Monaco. Not very near nice, i walked a lot but fhere are a lot of bus.

Very good place there is a big parking area nex to the road it allows the drivers stop easily.
The drivers pass slow in this place.
I waited on that spot, cars do slow down there so it's safe and easy.

Due to a stones falldown, the highway is closed, a deviation leads to Chambery and Lyon. You have to walk from Modane station to the previous roundabout of this spot, turn right and wait on the grass before the bridge. 2 cars stopped in the little crossroad within 15 minutes, got a ride almost to Lyon.

I took the train until modane and then i walk 20-30 minutes until this traffic light. It is situated just after a roundabout and every car who go on the highway pass her. People see you from far, you can talk to people, they can stop easily. Just 10 minutes to get a car to Lyon.

Service Station Agip

At the exit under the viaduct you're shaded/dry. My driver went to Grenoble so I got out just before Lyon.
peage, many trucks go this way to clermont-Ferrant, Millau and Montpellier, very good possibility for a nighttrip because of the long way.
Good ride to Rennes !

[Young male solo-traveller]
Good spot to get to Saumur/Tours

Good to go in Angers
Good spot to head to Nantes. This roundabout is special tho since there is 2 entries to the same highway and same direction. I guess both work
Excellent spot from cholet to nantes or rennes.

good to go to Cherbourg,Bayeux... or north/west coast

ou TARBES - PAU - BAYONNE

meilleur endroit pour aller vers Nice. best spot to Nice.

Tr√®s facile de sortir de Palais √† tout moment de la journ√©e, par contre il y a de moins en moins de stoppeurs √† cause de la nouvelle ligne de bus. Mais les stopeurs existerons toujours ! Realy fast and simple for all on this Iles!

Towards Angers/Paris

near the traffic light.

safer than on the lane

So fast, to go directly to Nantes it's the best option

I was drop there so I don't know how to go from Chalon

5s hitch to Morgat!

Nice spot, lot of cars passing by.

Bon spot, pas mal de passage.

(Alix & Gabin)

bon spot pour sortir de la teste et aller direction bayonne/bordeaux

2 persons.

Best place to leave Montpelier in direction of Spain, I caught a car in 10min going directly to Sevilla without a panel... I was lucky

Did not work at all : some people were trying to help us, but only went to morth-east of Paris, and there was no one there after 1am so we went to sleep. Aldo some people stopped almost no one was going to Paris. Fortunately I got taken to the center of Paris by an Ethiopian family
Took us to champs-√©lys√©es. Good spot to go into the city, just ask around cars stopping to get gas and look for 75 license plates. 20min wait.

We spent the night at this gas station camping at the end of the trucker field. Quite a nice place to camp, noone bothered us. Next morning we started hitching at the petrol station at 8 am. The people here were super friendly. It's a great station to get on the other side of Paris without entering the city. We did this quite well as we found two nice people who took us al the way to Alicante.

Really big and busy gas station. We asked to over hundred cars before finding one that was going anywhere in Paris. We spoke both english and FRench, with no help. It felt like being in Italy, people just pretending they were not passing from Paris. 1:40 waiting time
Too a busy service station

Had √† sign Poitiers and nobody took so we decided to up our thumb and someone nice who had nothing to do of their afternoon (bc blocked outside of home) helped us reach the nearest peage. We waited for 2 hours so I would not recommand
Nice place for cars to stop, and directly going on the highway to the north. We got a ride to the next petrol station.

I always go to this place if I want to go to Angouleme. The cars give me a lift to the service station 10min later before the peage. Then I ask directly to the people at the station ad in 20min, sometimes less they go to Angouleme.

Was trying to get across the ferry. There is not a lot of cars here. Had no luck, asked even the cars with the french licence plates. Then i got a ride to the port, but not across it, because the people got the cheaper ticket where you cant change the amount of passangers.

Not a lot of throughput here but a decent spot if you want to go to england. We got a ride with somebody on the boat for free. The ferry company can change the booking to include more passengers for free!

je recommande pas forc√©ment ce spot pour aller √† nantes, la plupart retournent dans le centre de vannes. je pense qu‚Äôil peut fonctionner mais il faut √™tre tr√®s chanceux-se !

Objectif : Vannes - Paris. Sur mon panneau j‚Äôai mis Rennes, vous avez aussi le choix de passer par Nantes. Ce spot est pratique car les voitures peuvent s‚Äôarr√™ter directement apr√®s et c‚Äôest une voie rapide juste apr√®s en direction de Nantes et de Rennes, donc cela augmente vos chances.

1H30 d'attente pour √™tre amen√© au p√©age direction bordeaux. Il y a une ligne de bus souvent libre pour permettre aux voitures de s'arr√™ter. Beaucoup de trafic et de r√©actions de la part des automobilistes. Peut-√™tre que la manifestation a rendu les choses plus compliqu√©es...
Werent successful in the dusk. Worked the next morning.
Lot of space to pull over, we still waited one hour (1 girl 1 boy) with an "A62 - P√©age" Sign. We changed for "A62 - Bordeaux" the last 10 minutes
great spot to go to Bordeaux. with panels

excellent !

Spot to Paris. Take the bus 30 from dijon center and stop at vaux bruns and you will be at this spot !

To go north or south

[Young male solo-traveller]

August 2023 Towards Vierzon. 2 male hikers with a Tours sign.

arriving from nantes, we get off here from a car going to orl√©ans because our aim was lyon and chamb√©ry. it was lunch time and there were quite many people going in all possible directions (nantes, orl√©ans, poitiers, bourges). we got a ride direct to chamb√©ry (wouhou) after about 1h, but other people had offered us a ride in other directions before.

Woked better holding a sign with Mondane, a truck stoped after 5 mins

P√É¬©age des marches
De plus en plus de gens ne s'arr√É¬™tent m√É¬™me plus gr√É¬¢ce aux abonnements, prenez une grosse pancarte; direction: Grenoble/ Italie
Not mutch space for Cars and the Traffic is fast. Wait 60 min than the Police told me to go.
There‚Äôs only a little place for cars to stop and cars are also going pretty fast, but ve were lucky and one couole took us to Perpignan Sud.
very good destination to the PEAGE for the highway direction to north and northwest.

Arround noon.

I waited on the ramp with a sign for Pau and got a ride within 10 minutes. If Pau is not your destination there is a p√©age just before it so you can easily continue westward. Easy to reach along Avenue Jules Julien from nearest Metro station (Saint-Agne). A lot of traffic but cars are going in many different directions.
Monday afternoon, big trafick, fast lift.
Started sunday evening, but with no luck at all.
Roundabout direction to Bordeaux and Toulouse

Surprised by the comments, i don't know if it was the rain or because we were two but nobody stoped, we had a sign to Lyon but we changed after 90 minutes for Dijon and someone took us but only for a short ride to the rest stop of Toul.

Good spot. 

Once got picked up in ten minutes, trying to get to Paris. Was left at the Toul's rest area, do not recommend. Everyone was going south, after a few hours a truck driver took me towards Paris.

best deal in Nancy to head south or to Paris. Did it a hundred times. There are plenty of places to stop and people see you from far away because it's a straight line. From the city center, take the bus n¬∞4 to reach Laxou

No place to stop for cars. Don't recommend needed to change spot

worked for me, but just because I was lucky and someone who drives blablacar dropped somebody off right next to me. I think there is a better chance when you walk down the road further more.

Not a perfect spot but enough space to  stop.

Its a little bit dangerous, There are a lot of trucks very near from the margin of the road, but we had good luck and a woman that was going to Orleans left us at the Service Area near Orleans then we take another car in 10 minutes to Tours.
We saw someone leave for a far away city just in front of us be we waited 45 minutes and no-one stopped :/ easier to cheat the train 2km away.

Very good spot because almost every car driving in the Nantes or Orleans (and so on) direction go by this way. Tried this stop multiple times, alone and with more people.
it does not seem to work as much as it used to. I prefer the spot on the D700 since I got picked more quickly there a handful of times.
15min to get a ride to Rennes. Great spot!
i waited 1min and get a ride to rennes.

Yeah ! So obvious here.

just perfect, many time i us this way to go to paris, at least they leave you at the first rest area on the A6.

I agree with fernand, not direct after the "rond point" but agter there is a good lane. I think it's the best spot form rennes to get La Gravelles' toll and then Paris
I only waited 5 minutes to find a lift to Nancy
tr√®s mauvais spot pour aller direction reims, je conseille de monter jusqu‚Äô√† mezieres si possible (a la rocade)

Very good spot to go to Toulouse. Enough space to stop and a lot of traffic.

I was standing just before the toll for the direction of Pau/Bordeaux, on the side with a sign for Pau. After approx 25 min a car stopped after the toll and the guy took me quite close but on the highway to Pau so it was good for. I think I was not visible with the toll cameras since I was standing about 15m before the barrier and I was not kicked out by the highway staff.
A lot of local traffic here and very little cars going to Bordeaux.
After 2 hours I didn't get a ride. It is not a bad spot though. Getting out of Marseille is really difficult
Infront of a hotel. Great spot to go out of Marseille!

I didn't enjoy hitching there, but you can't argue the results. I stood after the pedestrian crossing to stand out from the crowd, but I gues you could go before and ask the drivers waiting on the red light. I had sign "A10".

looks a bit dodgy at first, but it's not to bad. (2016) try interacting with cars waiting at the traffic light. We got a Ride to Orleans within 45 min.

Good spot but try to don't hitchhike in Paris, Parisian don't very like this thing.
I gave up after 2 hours standing at the traffic lights, and saw another hitchhiker also trying with no luck. But I know a friend who manages to get lifts from the petrol station

The place looks fine at the first glance, you can see cardboard pieces dropped on the ground that gives you confidence. However, the traffic is big and rapid, who's not driving on the left lane won't be able to pull off at all. If people even see you they won't have the time and space enough for stopping. Rather outside of town...

I don't like this spot, doesn't really work if there's high traffic, cars are going fast and can't safely stop which was the case both times I've tried there. Maybe better at bus stop but not sure. I'd rather go to the highway entrance at Av. du Haut L√©v√™que, already after the Rocade.

The place seems good to hitchhike but yet I waited a long moment before I was driven to a highway gas station about 20km from there. Lots of place to stop but apparently didn't work so good.

Great spot to get south down A63. Waited 20 mins a bit further down as there were other hitchhikers at the bus stop. As soon as we saw them get a lift we went to bus stop and got a lift before we even got our signs out again
good, after 30mn someone took me to a gas station along A63, from there I had a ride to Irun with a truck.
a lot of cars but not much which stop

good enough

Arrives at 22h20, got a ride about 15- later to the next station service (with a sign "station service" as recommended above). One guy stopped, but continued as there wasn't a comfortable place to stop, not much later someone else stopped and just parked close to the side until we could enter.
I got a ride in 1 min, the first car took me. But I think that was luck.

Normal spot, just before the autoroute. Easy to stop there. I took the first car who was heading to the north. If i remember well, the problem here is that there is 2 directions (South like Montpellier or Marseille and North like Lyon).
boy & girl with backpacks, sunday evening, after sunset, sign to Avinon. Waited for 15 min. and got a lift from young spanish couple.

boy & girl with backpacks, sunday evening, sunny, sign to Arles. Waited for 60min. No one stoped. :(
Raunabout before peage to A7 south-east from Orange.

reste un tr√®s bon spot pour sortir de brest direction quimper. j‚Äôai tent√© direction crozon et c‚Äôest pass√©. seul point n√©gatif peu de places pour que les voitures s‚Äôarr√™tent et √©viter les heures de pointes c‚Äôest vraiment dangereux pour vous et les conducteurs üòâ
Good place to go too Quimper
Never had to wait for too long when going up North. I simply did not try to find THE car to the North Coast, but reached the others roundabouts of the N265, this works well in both directions.
Cars are going quite fast at this roundabout, never tried, but this probably works. Anyway if not, just go at the end of the N265 up north (second exit just on your back), this should work too

The solution to catch the more cars leaving the city: the roundabout of Kergleuz southeast extremity of Brest, at the entrance of Relecq-Kerhuon. The only way to get there is to be dropped off by a car.
super spot pour nous, 2 gars de 23 ans, on s'est mis sur la gauche du feu rouge, pas de panneau
Tr√®s pratique pour aller √† Grenoble

Homme blanc, seul, avec une pancarte Gen√®ve/Annecy et qui proposait des cookies. De 9h √† 10h30. Possibilit√© pour les voitures de s'arr√™ter rapidement sur la voie des bus, mais personne ne s'est arr√™t√©.
For us it wasn't a good spot because there is to much traffic and not really space for cars to pull over. May there is a better spot. We didn*t see it.
Spot tr√®s pratique pour rejoindre la A 43 direction Chambery et Grenoble. Feu tricolores √† la sortie du m√©tro Mermoz-Pinel (ligne D).

Asked around, thanks Micha Brough me to Basel

I think it doesn't make too much sense for french people crossing the border here going north because there is a highway parallel to the german one on the french side.

Well, but where would you go then? It's not more difficult to find a ride to Germany here than on any other gas station on this road! Try small trucks, a lot of craftsmen work across the border. 25 minutes to find a ride to Karlsruhe.
Il faut profiter du feu rouge pour aller approcher les conducteurs, et chercher qqn qui va au p√©age de Villefranche üëå

There was another hitcher there before me and because he had waited there for four hours before me, I chose after two hours to take another route - buses to the service station on the motorway.

waited 10 minutes at 7am a Saturday morning. Not much traffic so driver just stopped in the middle of the road and dropped me at the next service station north (paisy/bruy√®re). I'd recommend trying to get directly to that service station to start off if possible.

Waited there for one hour with another hitchhiker.
The woman took me to the Macon.

not even 8min after i was there, a guy stopped but he was going north (im heading west) and told me to try on the other entrace to the haighway (that i put as direction) thats way easier. he said he did it from there last summer and it was quite easy...lets see!
rot time to short mfg ew
Good place to get on the highway. there are some lights where everyone has to stop and after that there is enough place for the drivers to pull over.

Good spot if you want to go to Bilbao. A lot of cars go there. But we wanted to go south (Burgos, Madrid). After 3hours We had a ride to Zaragoza.

Nobody's going to Caen
There are a lot of cars and a lot of place to park but the people driving are unfriendly, i waited 2 hours, people don't say hello and don't smile, there are more chances that they make you a fuck üñï, you should never go to Rouen it's one of the worst place to hitchhack in France

after 20min, i got a ride to bosgouet rest area (direction caen) from someone going to le havre. my aim was nantes and it worked well then. i guess there are lots of locals at this spot.

to go here, take the Bus 7,

Not bad for either north or south.

DIRECTION CLERMONT-FERRAND - MONTPELLIER

two way direction, so a lot of possibilities there...

((we found two other hitchhikers here and were all really sad when we realised we're all trying to get out of a rlly bad spot)) dont recommend this spot over the other side of the road

I really don't understand how this works... I was thumbing around different parking lots, asking different people, all unsuccessful. D√©pos√© ici pour continuer vers Clermont-Ferrand par quelqu'un s'arr√™tant √† Saint-√âtienne. Beaucoup de trafic, mais attente un peu longue au rond-point. √áa vaut s√ªrement le coup d'aborder les conducteurs √† la station service.
Gas station

In the morning of the national holiday, not many people. We (2) asked around and had a sign 'Allemagne/Deutschland'. We didn't succeed. After more than 1,5 hours, we tried to go to Metz which was quite hard too.

Lots of Belgian cars.
a lot of spanish lorries, and you'll get towards luxemburg in no time if you want to go there. very much harder to go paris or even strasbourg from here.
spot ok pour aller √† lorient, ne pas aller plus loin les gens n‚Äôy vont pas. se mettre au rond point

When going East...

car can stop easily.
not many cars outside work hours.
Not that many people on a morning and a huge station. We got a lift after 90min.

I did not get a ride here in 1h, further at the "Nantes" sortie of the roundabout it worked  well and quick, wasn't that scary as it looks like on the map

Sketchy but work to get on the highway direction marseille. Ask for the nearest petrol station

we were heading to Auxerre (a6) it took us around an hour. there were other hitch hikers as well. we got a lift to a gas station on the A6. not the best place though in the end it worked out ok
Not super many cars, but easy to get a ride to Aire de Lan√ßon

Dropped here (3PM) by a guy who picked me back in Paris, I was trying to reach Grenoble and only did so because of luck. Someone picked me at 6PM, I was about to lose hope and look for a spot to spend the night when my saviour drove me to destination.

Conduit (√† 15h) ici par quelqu'un qui m'a pris de Paris, j'ai essay√© d'atteindre Grenoble. Un gentil conducteur m'a pris √† 18h alors que je m'appr√™tai
Waited for almost 8 or 9 hours trying to go East to Geneva. Hopeless! Ended up going to Lyon in one ride. Many people going South.
The first day of summer holidays all the people come to the South. There were two cars stopping in the two hours time but both were only locals. Direction Geneva seemed hopeless.
Safe place for you to hitchhike but not for cars to stop. Of you go towards Bordeaux like me cars will on the left Lane and not the right one so i waited kind of a long Time

A petrol station. Good place to go eastwards
Pour sortir de Toulon vers saint tropez, saint Rapha√´l. Pas beaucoup de fr√©quentation. Accessible par un portail c√¥t√© zone industrielle, pas besoin de s'aventurer sur l'autoroute.

There is a possibility to get to the next Service Station Aire de Limours with public transport and a 30 minutes walk and a fence (easy to climb). Sounds like an effort but is probably the best way to get out of the city.
no cars, only buses (2023)

Pas trop mal pour rejoindre grenoble, mais pas beaucoup de passage

Worst spot I've ever been to. Place is hard as fuck to get there, I almost fell multiple times cause the ground was all muddy. There was no traffic at all and people don't go north to far, the closest I found was Charles de Gaulle with a sign marked "A1"! I'll never go there again.

Failed to hitch out of Calais from here, two of us tried to hitch from the road to calais towards the roundabout for several hours but there was nothing. I think a group went up the hill onto the motorway sliproad and got a lift. We were not keen to do this as it's farily unsafe for cars to stop but maybe there is a good spot at the top of the hill, should probably have checked with hindsight ...

I  was standing with sign 'Rouen'. It is terrible idea to hitch-hike from here to West. It is better to be dropped at the nearest toll station or service station. One worker of the port picked me up and droped out on the toll station where I had no problem with finding truck driver who was going west to rouen.

HORRIBLE! Waited 2hours in the freezing "summer"wind ‚Äì 5 people stopped. 2 not going my way. 3 of them doubtful figures, with which one of them I ended up leaving from there, because I was so desperate ‚Äì¬†which then left me at a desolate parking lot, where the only people there were locals from Dukerque, where I then spent the night at a Formula 1 Hostel for 31‚Ç¨. Also felt like missing the main car-stream there.

got dropped here by locals and told that its a good spot for direction southwest (it isnt). after some hours and trying of different spots we decided to leave this spot, heavy traffic, not so much space to stop, little chaotic, we went for a walk and built up tent at near lake

J'ai test√© ce spot plusieurs fois pour Paris et Besan√ßon. Je trouve pr√©f√©rable de stopper au dernier feu tricolore de l'avenue des vosges qu'en face de la maison du b√¢timent (l√† o√π il y a la piste cyclable). Temps d'attente tr√®s variable.

good place,  All traffic through the Chamonix

Pas le meilleur endroit si il n'y a pas beaucoup de voitures. Un peu dangereux

Wait just after the roundabout (not further, it may be dangerous).

seems like the perfect spot but never rlly worked for me

Lane to Lille and Motorway was blocked maybe not permanent?

This place is also terrible, i prefer th√© other one, i think there is a bit more traffic, but still, Cholet is a nightmare place

Not a good spot

Not the best spot to be as it is after a curve in the road. And you‚Äôre not allowed to be there on foot‚Ä¶ tho I quickly had a ride to the Peage above Montauban. There you can easily go to Paris.
Not a good spot , very few traffic in direction of Bayonne . Plus I have been told by the police not to hitchhike close to the doll
Entr√©e d'autoroute peu fr√©quent√©e lors de mon passage.

On a sunday afternoon without a sign.
I had three possible rides in a few minutes, there is place to stop in front of the hostel, even though cars go a bit too fast to have time to stop.

11 juillet 2014. 

J'ai fais du stop ici car j'y avait √©t√© d√©pos√©. Tr√®s mauvais endroit. La personne qui m'a prit l'a fait pour me sortir de l√† et m'ammener dans un lieu meilleur.

Pas de place pour s'arr√™ter sans g√™ner la circulation.

NOT a good spot towards Paris. Yes we were 3 but we waited for 2 days. Most cars that stopped were going to Niort (south) and not toward Paris. Maybe a better idea to try north of Poitiers to go North.

When i figured out the trick it took me only like 15mins... I met a guy once at the roundabout before the paypoint who had waited alrteady over a day...

I can't remember how long we waited but I think we only saw like 7 cars pass : it was desert (it was on a Saturday afternoon, maybe it's different other days ?). Hopefully, a truck (the only big one that took me in Brittany and France) took me to Gwengamp !!!
THE solution if you were left at the pempoull (paimpol) exit. You will have to walk for 10 minutes before reaching this empty spot.

I agree that it's a really weird spot and it was mostly locals but there's space to stand at the side of the turnaround (if a bit windy, also no shelter, so not a spot for bad weather) and cars can stop too. I was told by locals to try in here, but it's just a waist of time. People is busy and the area isn't the best place to stop. I got picked up after 1h and half, and the bro left me in a random gas station right before the airport where none of the cars were going north. So I managed to comeback to Paris and get a BlablaBus to Brussels. If you are in the countryside, try to hitchhike. If you are in Paris center, going to north, just trust me and pay for a cheap bus.

I think this is technically a good spot but I was unlucky here twice.
First time I got dropped off at the Paris Tille airport because the guy did not want me to hitchhike in the dark and asked me to spend the night in the airport. Well, the airport closed for the night and I had to take bus back to Paris to not be on the streets for the freezing night!
The other day I got soaking wet with no ride in two hours and gave up eventually, took a BlaBlaCar for the first big service station on the mot

Used to get a ride here some years ago, was quite a long wait. Also picked up people couple times from there, recently the road at this spot has become more narrow, much less comfortable for a driver to stop than it used to be!
